meta.job_title: Clinical Application Specialist - Neurovascular Medical Device

duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide educational and clinical support in response to field inquiries from Sim&Cure customers to support physicians and health care professionals.
Sustain a high level of communication with the customers and Key Account Managers to ensure timely, high-quality education and training on Sim&Cure products for health care providers.
Prepare, analyze, and report the use, education/training, and support activities of the sales team to advance new users of the system and identify new opportunities.
Operate effectively within the defined territory and within the expense budget.
Maintain medical device directive compliance in all customer interactions and communications.
Assist other territories to grow and develop.
Support conferences, workshops and other marketing events as scheduled by management.
Screen and troubleshoot cases as needed.
Install Sim&Cure products within clinical environments such as hospitals and partnered Medical Device Company laptops depending upon the needs of Sim&Cure and its customers.
Professionally represent the company during customer interactions for the purpose of supporting customer sales.
Collaborate with the Key Account Managers to develop and grow business within the territories.
Work within accounts to maximize the use of Sim&Cure’s product line by ensuring customer confidence in Sim&Size technology through consistent and successful procedural performance.
Troubleshoot internal software, IT, and Hospital based systems.
Perform other duties as assigned by manager.

education_certification.credential: Interventional Technologist - A.A.S, A.S or B.S, B.A with a minimum of 5 years of work experience in healthcare within an Interventional Lab.Equivalent work or educational experiences accepted: Biomedical Engineering or Procedural Nurse
